They are also some of the friendliest folks you will ever want to meet, smiling (behind their masks) and waving to nearly every car that passes. Although they are pictured without their masks (so you can see more than just a pair of eyeballs), our 2020 guards are following mask mandates while crossing the children. So as you‚Äôre driving through town, give the guards a friendly wave and if you get the chance, thank them for their dedication to this community.

Miss Young will teach you how to make Homemade Playdoh.

Recipe:
Put 3/4 cup of water into a bowl with 4 drops of your favorite food coloring and 1/2 tablespoon of oil. In a separate bowl put 1 cup of flour and 1/2 a cup of salt. Mix together. Pour the bowl with flour and salt into the bowl with water, food coloring and oil. Mix super well. Then, put a little flour onto a board (to make sure the Playdoh does not stick to the board). Pour the Playdoh onto the board and kneed until the Playdoh is no longer sticky. Add more flour if it is too sticky and add more water if too dry. HAVE FUN!!!
